title: Drawing, "Design for a Trophy Vase", 1942
medium: Pen and black, red ink, red color pencil, graphite on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, upper right: 228
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink, lower center: VASE/TROPHEE/DIAMETRE 15 cms (SANS ANSES)/HAUTEUR 22 cms 1/2; lower right: JEAN PUIFORCAT/42
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description: Cup-shaped trophy drawn in plan and elevation. The tapering body with a trapezoidal-shaped rosewood base suspended at the top by two circular handles within a U-shaped frame indicated in red ink and red color pencil. The frame decorated on each side with two single applied bands, raised on a tall cylindrical base, decorated at the foot rim with two applied bands. Underdrawing in graphite of the trophy in golden section.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Trophy Vase", 1942.
1942. Pen and black, red ink, red color pencil, graphite on cream tracing paper. Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra. 1995-164-30.
